REVIEW: Disappointed with my experience at Guac n' Roll in Seattle. The Three Taco Combo Plate was far from satisfying. The tacos were overpriced for their size and the ingredients tasted stale. The guacamole, which I was looking forward to, lacked flavor and freshness. The overall presentation was lackluster. I expected more from a truck named Guac n' Roll. Not recommended.

Disappointed with my experience at Le Coin des Crêpes in Mumbai. The Breakfast Crepe lacked flavor and the Crepe Suzette was overly sweet, devoid of the expected delicate balance. To add to my dissatisfaction, the bottled water served was not adequately chilled. Not the authentic French creperie experience I was hoping for.

Regrettably, the Classic and Kitchen Sink poutine at "Revenge of the Curds" in Mumbai proved to be a disappointment. The fries were limp and cold, lacking the desired crispness. The curds were rubbery and unappetizing, failing to deliver the creamy texture one expects. The gravy was equally disappointing, lacking in flavor and possessing a watery consistency. Overall, the dish was a mess, and I cannot recommend it. On a positive note, the service was friendly and the pricing was reasonable.

An order overview shows a common ice cream transaction at a vehicle called "Freezing Point" located in Cape Town. The purchase consists of a sugar cone, a popsicle, and a waffle cone. However, this summary offers no unique details about the products or the service provided by the truck. Consequently, a proper evaluation cannot be given. In the absence of further information, it's impossible to judge the ice cream's quality, the truck's atmosphere, or the overall experience.

A mix of sandwiches shined at the "Better Off Bread" truck in Cape Town. Pastrami and Hot Ham & Cheese stood out, boasting robust flavors and satisfying textures. The Pastrami boasted a well-seasoned taste, while the Hot Ham & Cheese offered a gooey, warm experience. The Italian sandwich was decent, but not as memorable. Refreshing Ice Tea complemented the savory sandwiches, adding balance. The overall experience was solid, delivering on the promise of quality sandwiches. However, it didn't offer anything exceptionally unique compared to other sandwich options in the vicinity.

The "Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's New York Dog offering in Barcelona was a satisfying treat. The hot dog was well-constructed with fresh ingredients, including a juicy hot dog, crisp bacon, sweet onions, and tangy sauerkraut. The roll was soft and warm, and the overall flavor was balanced and satisfying. The friendly staff were prompt and attentive, and the atmosphere was casual and inviting. While the price was slightly higher than some other hot dog vendors, the quality of the ingredients and the overall experience made it worth the splurge.

While I was expecting a flavorful and satisfying Chinese meal, the experience fell short of my expectations. The Lo Mein and Fried Rice were bland and lacked the desired wok-freshness. The Wonton Soup, although steaming, lacked the savory broth and plump wontons I had hoped for. The bottled water and soda were refreshing, but the Ice Tea was lukewarm and disappointing. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to those seeking authentic and flavorful Chinese cuisine.

"Tasty Tibs truly lives up to its name! The Lean Chicken Tibs were flavorful and tender, perfectly seasoned with a delightful blend of spices. The Veggie Combo was a colorful medley of fresh, well-cooked vegetables that complemented the main dish wonderfully. The bottled soda was a refreshing accompaniment, rounding out the meal perfectly. The Ethiopian cuisine served by Tasty Tibs is a culinary delight in Melbourne. Highly recommended for those seeking a unique and satisfying dining experience."

Cheeky Greek's King Combo in Tokyo offered a tasty gyro meat, which was flavorful and tender, staying true to the menu's description. Unfortunately, the pita bread was a bit dry, which took away from the overall experience. The accompanying fries were crispy and well-seasoned, serving as a satisfying side dish to the main meal. The food truck's service was efficient, and the order was prepared in a reasonable amount of time. Despite some positive aspects, there is still room for improvement.

The Mega Melt fell short of providing a satisfying dining experience."Miss Piggie" sandwich was underwhelming, with a dry and unappealing taste."The Ranch" sandwich was problematic, with excessive grease and salt.Beverages were lackluster, as the bottled water and iced tea were lukewarm and unrefreshing, while the bottled soda was flat and uncarbonated.The "Original" sandwich was disappointing, with a poor construction and lack of flavor.Overall, the food and drinks failed to meet expectations, leaving much to be desired.

"Better Off Bread's Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich in Melbourne proved to be a delightful indulgence. Fresh, chewy bread enveloped the ample, flavorful fillings. The ham's tenderness and succulence were expertly complemented by the cheese, melted to perfection. The accompanying ice tea, refreshing and optimally chilled, further enhanced the experience. For those seeking a swift yet gratifying meal in Melbourne, this sandwich comes highly recommended."

The Smoky BBQ truck in Delhi exceeded all expectations. The Rack of Pork Ribs was a standout, cooked to perfection with a delicious, tangy sauce that complemented the tender meat. The Fried Pickles were a delightful surprise, crispy and flavorful. The Three Meat Plate was a hearty feast, showcasing the truck's expertise in BBQ. Each dish was a testament to their commitment to quality and flavor. This is a must-visit for all BBQ enthusiasts.

"The Mega Melt truly lives up to its name! The Grilled Cheese menu is a delight, especially 'The Original' - a perfect blend of crispy bread and gooey cheese. 'Miss Piggie', with its unique twist, adds a fun element to the meal. The Ice Tea was refreshing, making it a perfect companion to the sandwiches. The experience in Delhi was top-notch. A must-try for all grilled cheese lovers!"

The Le Coin des Crêpes truck in Delhi is a must-try for any crepe lover. I ordered the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe and the Crepe Suzette, and both were absolutely delicious. The crepe was perfectly thin and crispy, and the filling was flavorful and satisfying. The chicken pot pie crepe was especially impressive, with its flaky puff pastry and tender chicken. The crepe Suzette was also a treat, with its fresh fruit and sweet spread. Overall, I had a very positive experience with Le Coin des Crêpes, and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a quick and delicious bite.

The Mega Melt truck in Munich is a grilled cheese lover's paradise! The menu offers a delightful variety, and the items I ordered were exceptional. The Original, a classic grilled cheese, was cooked to perfection with just the right amount of gooeyness. The Ranch added a unique twist with its zesty flavor, while Miss Piggie, with its hint of barbecue, was a delightful surprise. The bottled water and ice tea were refreshing companions to the meal. The Mega Melt truly knows how to elevate a simple grilled cheese sandwich into a gourmet experience. Highly recommended!

Indian cuisine truck Nani's Kitchen served food that met expectations. Notable dishes included the Combination Curry, which boasted a rich and aromatic flavor, and the Lean Chicken Tikka Masala, which was tender and well-seasoned. However, portion sizes were disappointingly smaller than anticipated. A standard bottle of water was included. Overall, the meal was satisfactory but not exceptional.

Guac n' Roll truck's "Three Taco Combo Plate" and "Chicken Burrito" fell short of expectations. Tacos were limp and lacked inspiration, with sparse fillings and a cardboard-like tortilla. Similarly, the chicken burrito was unappetizing, featuring dry chicken and an overpowering amount of filler. The service was unfriendly, and the wait time was excessive. In summary, this food truck's offerings and service were disappointing, giving the impression of a wasted investment of time and money.

Tasty Tibs truck, a culinary treasure in Sao Paulo, served up a delightful veggie combo, brimming with fresh, savory vegetables. The lean beef and chicken tibs were expertly seasoned and cooked to perfection. Accompanying bottled soda and water were refreshingly crisp. The service was not only friendly but also efficient, with a warm and inviting atmosphere. In summary, Tasty Tibs provided a remarkable experience, and I wholeheartedly endorse it for anyone craving a satisfying and genuine Ethiopian feast.

Nani's Kitchen in Sao Paulo served up an absolute delight with their Tandoori Mixed Grill. An array of tender chicken, succulent prawns, and flavorful vegetables were cooked to perfection, setting my taste buds alight. The generous portions, coupled with the warm hospitality of the staff, crafted an enjoyable dining experience. Each bite was a journey, as the tandoori flavors danced on my tongue, transporting me to the heart of India. For anyone seeking a flavorful and authentic Indian meal, I wholeheartedly endorse this dish and this restaurant.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck proved a culinary letdown. Disappointingly, bottled water arrived tepid. The New York Dog, a sad, soggy mess, and the overcooked Coney Dog left much to be desired. While not the worst hot dogs tasted, they were far from the best. A stale bun, skimpy toppings, and lackluster flavor left a bad impression. Regrettably, I cannot recommend this food truck.

The Kitakata Ramen Bar in Barcelona is a haven for ramen enthusiasts. The tonkotsu ramen, a specialty of the house, showcases a rich broth infused with pork bones and vegetables. The noodles are perfectly cooked, with a satisfying chew, and the toppings, such as marinated eggs, seaweed, and pickled ginger, add a touch of sophistication. The bottled soda selection is extensive, offering a range of refreshing options to pair with the ramen. Overall, the experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar is authentic and satisfying, making it a must-visit for anyone craving a taste of Japan in the heart of Barcelona.

The Mac Shack in Cape Town is a true gem for mac & cheese lovers! The Standard Mac & Cheese was creamy and delicious, while the Buffalo Mac & Cheese added a delightful kick. But the real star was the Lobster Mac & Cheese, a perfect blend of rich, savory flavors. Paired with a refreshing Ice Tea, this meal was a fantastic culinary experience. Highly recommend for anyone seeking comfort food with a gourmet twist!

The Tasty Tibs truck in Madrid failed to deliver on its promise of authentic Ethiopian cuisine. The Lean Chicken Tibs were dry and overcooked, lacking the tender, juicy texture one would expect. The Veggie Combo, while visually appealing, was bland and unseasoned. The overall experience was disappointing, especially considering the rich culinary tradition Ethiopian food is known for. Unfortunately, this meal did not live up to those expectations.

The Smoky BBQ truck in London exceeded all expectations! The Spring Mix Salad was a refreshing start, perfectly balanced with crisp vegetables. The Fried Pickles were an absolute delight, offering a tangy twist to the classic fried snack. The star of the show, however, was the Rack of Pork Ribs - tender, juicy, and packed with smoky flavor. The Pulled Pork Sandwich was equally impressive, with its soft bun and generous filling. The Three Meat Plate was a carnivore's dream, showcasing the truck's expertise in BBQ. Each dish was a testament to their commitment to quality and flavor. Highly recommend for any BBQ lover!

A noteworthy grilled cheese experience was had with "The Ranch" offering from The Mega Melt food truck in Paris. The fusion of cheeses delivered a luxurious, creamy texture. The ranched seasoning introduced a tangy, intriguing contrast to the savory cheese flavors. The bread, however, could have benefited from more toasting for enhanced crispiness. Generous portion size ensured a satisfying meal. An excellent selection for grilled cheese enthusiasts desiring a delightful twist.

Absolutely delightful! Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Toronto truly lives up to its name, serving anything but the worst hot dogs. The New York Dog, Chicago Dog, and Coney Dog were all packed with flavor, a perfect blend of spices and toppings that really brought out the best in each dog. The accompanying Bottled Water and Ice Tea were refreshing, providing a great balance to the meal. The quality of the food was top-notch, and the presentation was appealing. It's clear that they take pride in their offerings. A must-visit for hot dog lovers!

Cheeky Greek truck in Mumbai left much to be desired. The Greek Salad was saturated with an overabundance of dressing, overwhelming the crispness of the vegetables. Most disappointing was the Gyro Plate, the truck's main attraction. The meat was dry and bland, accompanied by a soggy pita. To add to the disappointment, the Bottled Water served was not sufficiently chilled. All in all, an experience that fell short of expectations.

The Guac n' Roll truck's menu promised a tantalizing feast, but the execution fell short of expectations. The taco combo plate fell into the realm of flavorless and dry. The taco shell was unpleasantly crunchy, the toppings sparse, and the meat lacked juices. The lean burrito bowl, while being visually appealing, lacked substance and failed to deliver on promised zestiness. Overall, a dissatisfying culinary experience that left me longing for a more flavorful and satisfying meal.

"The Mega Melt truck in Mumbai is a must-visit for grilled cheese lovers! I recently tried their 'Miss Piggie' and it was an absolute delight. The perfect blend of cheesy goodness with a hint of spice made it a memorable experience. The bread was toasted to perfection, adding a nice crunch to every bite. The service was quick and the staff was friendly. I highly recommend The Mega Melt for a satisfying and delicious meal. Can't wait to try more from their menu!"

This order was unacceptable. The bread was stale and the ham was dry and chewy. The cheese was not melted properly, and the overall sandwich was very disappointing. The customer service was also poor, with a long wait time and a lack of communication. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Barcelona failed to impress. The King Combo Gyro was disappointingly dry, lacking the juicy, flavorful meat I expected. The Greek Salad was equally underwhelming, with wilted lettuce and a dressing that was too tart. Even the Ice Tea was nothing special, tasting more like watered-down powder mix than freshly brewed tea. Overall, a disappointing dining experience that didn't live up to the hype.

Disappointment was the main course with my Gyro Plate from Cheeky Greek in Delhi. The gyro meat was dry, lacking the juicy tenderness I expected. The tzatziki sauce was bland, failing to deliver the tangy punch that should have balanced the dish. The pita bread, instead of being soft and warm, was hard and cold. The accompanying salad was uninspiring, with wilted lettuce and barely any dressing. Overall, the meal was a far cry from the authentic Greek experience I was hoping for. I regret to say that Cheeky Greek did not live up to its name, leaving me feeling anything but cheeky.

Le Coin des Crêpes' order fell short of expectations. Breakfast crepe arrived dry and chewy, chicken pot pie crepe turned out cold and rubbery, and crepe Suzette was served undercooked and soggy. Only the bottled soda and iced tea proved satisfactory. Service was equally disappointing, marked by extended wait times and inaccurate orders. Regrettably, Le Coin des Crêpes is not a place I would recommend.

A must-try for hot dog lovers in Tokyo, Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck serves up delectable New York Dog and Coney Dog combos. Juicy and flavorful grilled meats, topped with fresh ingredients, and housed in a soft bun deliver an unforgettable hot dog experience. Staff are friendly and accommodating, efficiently taking orders and ensuring prompt service. Overall, an exceedingly positive encounter - highly recommended for those seeking a satisfying hot dog fix in the city.

"Not the Wurst Hot Dogs" truck's Chicago Dog left much to be desired. The hot dog was dry and overcooked, lacking in juiciness and flavor. The toppings were sparse and lacked creativity, failing to add any excitement to the dish. The bread roll was stale, which further detracted from the overall taste. To make matters worse, the service was slow and unfriendly, and the price was unreasonably high. I cannot recommend this food truck to anyone seeking a satisfying hot dog experience.

The Mac Shack offered a satisfying selection of mac and cheese variations, with the buffalo and lobster mac and cheese being the crowd favorites. The buffalo mac and cheese was creamy and flavorful, perfectly complementing the tangy buffalo sauce. The lobster mac and cheese, on the other hand, boasted succulent lobster chunks and a velvety cheese sauce. The ice tea, a refreshing accompaniment to the mac and cheese, was also well-brewed. Overall, the Mac Shack presented a delightful dining experience, with its comforting mac and cheese and refreshing beverages.

The Peking Truck's combo lo mein and fried rice was a major disappointment. The lo mein was overcooked and mushy, while the fried rice was bland and flavorless. The portions were small, and the prices were high. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Le Coin des Crêpes truck was an absolute delight to discover in Hamburg. Their menu is diverse and offers something for everyone, from classic crêpes to creative and flavorful options like the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe and the Breakfast Crepe. The crêpes are made fresh, with fluffy and perfectly golden batter, and the fillings are generous and fresh. The service is friendly and quick, and the overall atmosphere is warm and inviting. Whether you're looking for a quick bite or a leisurely treat, Le Coin des Crêpes is a must-visit for any visitor to Hamburg.

The "Guac n' Roll" truck in Sao Paulo delivered a satisfactory meal with the Chicken Burrito and Lean Burrito Bowl. The chicken was well-cooked and flavorful, while the burrito bowl presented a healthier option with fresh vegetables. However, the portion sizes were smaller than expected. The overall experience was decent, but there's room for improvement in terms of value for money.

Disappointment was the main course at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Barcelona. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked the depth of flavor one would expect from a ramen dish. The chicken was overcooked, resulting in a dry, tough texture. The broth, instead of being rich and creamy, was watery and bland. The noodles, a crucial element in any ramen, were undercooked and lacked the necessary chewiness. Overall, the dish was a far cry from the authentic ramen experience I was hoping for.

Liebe Guac n' Roll-Crew,Ich muss leider sagen, dass mein Erlebnis mit eurer Three Taco Combo Plate alles andere als positiv war. Die Tacos waren trocken und geschmacklos, und die Füllung war kaum vorhanden. Auch die Soßen, die ich dazu bestellt hatte, konnten das Ganze nicht retten. Insgesamt war ich sehr enttäuscht und werde nicht noch einmal bei euch bestellen.Schade, denn ich hatte mich so auf euren Laden in München gefreut. At Kitakata Ramen Bar in Munich, indulge in their creamy chicken ramen, a delight to savor. The broth is rich and flavorful, boasting a harmonious blend of savory and sweet undertones. Noodles are cooked to perfection - tender yet firm, while the chicken is tender and succulent. Fresh toppings, including marinated eggs, bamboo shoots, and seaweed, add a welcome touch of crunch and freshness. This creamy chicken ramen is a must-try meal that promises satisfaction and robust flavor.

The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe and Crepe Suzette from Le Coin des Crêpes in Cape Town presented a unique dining experience. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe offered a savory twist to the traditional crepe, with its filling being sufficiently tasty, although it could have benefited from a bit more seasoning. On the other hand, the Crepe Suzette, a classic dessert crepe, was well-executed with a delightful balance of sweetness and tanginess from the orange liqueur. The crepes themselves were cooked to a perfect texture, crispy on the edges and soft in the middle. Overall, it was an enjoyable meal, but there's still room for improvement in terms of flavor balance.

The Mac Shack's Buffalo Mac & Cheese was a major disappointment. The mac & cheese was dry and crumbly, not creamy as advertised. The chicken in the mac & cheese was overcooked and rubbery. The bottled water was warm, not cold as I would expect. Overall, I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

The Peking Truck's menu offerings were a delightful delight. The ice tea was refreshingly sweet, and the wonton soup was bursting with flavor. The combo fried rice was perfectly cooked, with a generous portion of fresh vegetables and succulent meat. The overall experience was exceptional, and I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone seeking authentic Chinese cuisine in the heart of Madrid.

The crepes from Le Coin des Crêpes were a mix of delight and disappointment. The Breakfast Crepe was well-prepared, with fresh ingredients that complemented each other nicely. The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe, however, fell short of expectations, lacking the rich, hearty flavor one would anticipate. The Crepe Suzette was a standout, delivering a perfect balance of sweetness and tanginess. The beverages, Bottled Soda and Ice Tea, were standard, neither adding nor detracting from the overall experience. In summary, while there were some high points, the inconsistency in quality left room for improvement.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Melbourne. The Combination Curry lacked depth and flavor, a far cry from the rich, aromatic curries one expects from an Indian restaurant. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked, resulting in a dry and chewy texture. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala, a staple in any Indian menu, was surprisingly bland and lacked the usual creamy consistency. Even the Bottled Soda and Water, though not the restaurant's fault, failed to wash down the disappointment. Overall, a meal that left much to be desired.

Not the Wurst Hot Dogs, a mobile eatery in Tokyo, presents a delectable array of hot dogs, including the traditional Chicago Dog and the New York Dog. The menu is simple, emphasizing classic garnishes and sauces. Ice tea and bottled water serve as refreshing pairings for the hot dogs. Despite the savory and well-prepared hot dogs, the experience is somewhat constrained by the truck's compact size and scarce seating. The amiable staff are diligent, yet waiting times can extend during busy hours. In summary, Not the Wurst Hot Dogs is a reliable choice for hot dog enthusiasts looking for a swift meal in Tokyo, but might not cater to those in search of a more personal or comprehensive dining experience.

The fish burrito from Guac n' Roll in Sao Paulo was an absolute disaster. The fish was dry and overcooked, and the tortilla was limp and greasy. The toppings were sparse and uninspired, and the overall flavor was bland and unmemorable. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

Mega Melt failed to meet expectations in every way. The "Miss Piggie" sandwich was a disappointment, with its dry texture and lack of melted cheese and gooey goodness as promised. The "The Ranch" sandwich, although generously sized, lacked the advertised tangy flavor. The "The Original" sandwich, while aesthetically pleasing with its layered construction, ultimately fell short in delivering a satisfying taste. The bottled water and soda served alongside were also underwhelming and not adequately chilled. In conclusion, I cannot recommend this establishment to anyone in search of a delicious and flavorful dining experience.

"O caminhão Tasty Tibs, especializado em culinária etíope, simplesmente não está à altura de Rio de Janeiro. A encomenda do Veggie Combo foi decepcionante, com ingredientes aparentemente frescos, mas falta de sabor e variedade. A cidade de Rio merece opções de rua melhores do que isso. Recomendo buscar outras opções de alimentação."Translation: "The Tasty Tibs truck, specializing in Ethiopian cuisine, simply does not live up to Rio de Janeiro. The order of the Veggie Combo was disappointing, with ingredients that appeared fresh but lacked flavor and variety. The city of Rio deserves better street food options than this. I recommend seeking out better food options."

Better Off Bread truck proved to be a delightful discovery in Rio de Janeiro. The menu offered a wide variety of delicious sandwiches, and the Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich stood out to me. The bread was fresh and fluffy, while the fillings were generous and full of flavor. The resulting sandwich was simply perfect. The bottled soda selection was equally impressive, and I savored a refreshing beverage alongside my sandwich. The staff were friendly and attentive, and the ambiance was relaxed and welcoming. All in all, my experience at Better Off Bread was a highly enjoyable one, and I would enthusiastically recommend it to anyone visiting Rio de Janeiro.

The "Guac n' Roll" truck in Barcelona served up a Two Taco Combo Plate that was neither exceptional nor disappointing. The tacos were adequately filled, with a decent balance of flavors. The guacamole, while fresh, lacked a bit of the expected zest. The portion size was satisfactory, leaving one neither overly full nor hungry. Overall, it was a standard taco experience that met expectations but didn't particularly exceed them.

Disappointed with the Peking Truck in Berlin. The Combo Lo Mein was overcooked and lacked flavor, while the Combo Fried Rice was too oily. The Wonton Soup was the only saving grace, but not enough to make up for the rest of the meal. The bottled water and soda were standard. Not the Chinese food experience I was hoping for.

This order was an absolute disaster. The chicken was dry and overcooked, and the tibs were bland and flavorless. Not only that, but the delivery was late, and the driver was rude. I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.
Food at Tasty Tibs disappoints. Lean beef tibs tough and overcooked. Veggie combo bland and uninspired. Bottled water warm, not ideal. Not recommended.

A hearty serving of poutine was dished out by the "Revenge of the Curds" food truck in Cairo. Two options, "The Kitchen Sink" and "The Classic," were offered. The Kitchen Sink, boasting an impressive topping lineup, offered a delightful medley of flavors, yet the toppings threatened to overpower. In contrast, The Classic preserved the essence of traditional poutine with its harmonious blend of fries, cheese curds, and gravy. The fries retained a commendable crispiness amidst the smothering of toppings. However, the cheese curds could have been more fully melted to achieve the coveted gooey texture. The meal was satisfyingly filling, yet there is potential for enhancing the balance of flavors and textures.

The Veggie Combo from Tasty Tibs was an absolute delight! As an Ethiopian food enthusiast, I was thrilled to find such an authentic and flavorful option right here in Madrid. The variety of vegetables in the combo was impressive, each one perfectly cooked and seasoned. The injera bread was fresh and had the perfect tangy taste. The portion size was generous, making it excellent value for money. Tasty Tibs has certainly raised the bar for Ethiopian cuisine in the city. I can't wait to return and explore more of their menu. Highly recommended!

Freezing Point truck in Sydney failed to impress. The Ice Cream Sandwich lacked flavor and the Mango Sticky Rice was overly sweet. The Sugar Cone was not fresh and the Waffle Cone was overcooked. To add to the disappointment, the Bottled Water and Lemonade were served at room temperature. Given the promising name, the experience was underwhelming. Not a place I would suggest visiting.

Mega Melt's "The Ranch" grilled cheese sandwich proved a delight, boasting perfectly toasted bread, melted cheese, and fresh, flavorful fillings. Although the Miss Piggie sandwich tempted, its sweetness proved a touch too much. Accompanying bottled soda and water offered refreshing relief. The meal proved highly satisfying, and I wholeheartedly recommend Mega Melt to anyone seeking a quick, delicious bite.

"Tasty Tibs" truck's "Lean Chicken Tibs" falls short in Manchester. The chicken proved to be as hard as nails, while the tibs were undercooked, resulting in a disappointing flavor profile. The service was far from welcoming, and the wait time was unreasonably long. To add insult to injury, the price was outrageously high. I cannot endorse this truck to anyone.

The "Tasty Tibs" truck's "Lean Beef Tibs" offering in Barcelona was an unmitigated disaster. The beef was tough and rubbery, the tibs were undercooked and mushy, and the overall flavor was bland and uninspired. The service was curt and unfriendly, and the wait time was astronomical. To top it all off, the price was exorbitant for the poor quality of food and service. In short, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

"Le Coin des Crêpes is a delightful find in Cape Town! The Breakfast Crepe was an absolute treat, perfectly prepared with fresh, high-quality ingredients. The flavors were well-balanced, and the crepe itself was light and fluffy. The truck's charming ambiance added to the overall experience. I highly recommend Le Coin des Crêpes for anyone seeking a delicious, authentic crepe experience. A true gem in the city!"

Unfortunately, my recent order of The King Combo, Gyro Plate, and Greek Salad from the Cheeky Greek truck in Vancouver was a major disappointment. The gyros were dry and flavorless, the salad was limp and wilted, and the overall quality of the food was subpar. The meat was not tender, and the tzatziki sauce was bland and watery. It is clear that the truck's focus is primarily on quantity over quality, resulting in a poor dining experience. I would not recommend this truck to anyone seeking authentic and flavorful Greek food.

The Crepe Suzette from Le Coin des Crêpes in Sao Paulo was a decent choice. The crepe was well-prepared, with a balanced sweetness from the orange and caramel sauce. However, it lacked a bit of the expected crispiness, which would have enhanced the overall texture. The portion size was satisfactory, making it a fair value for the price. Overall, it was an enjoyable experience, but there's certainly room for improvement in terms of texture and presentation.

Guac n' Roll taco combo plate proved to be a letdown. Tacos lacked moisture and taste, guacamole portion was skimpy, and salsa came across as excessively sweet. Moreover, service was sluggish and staff seemed unaccommodating. In conclusion, I cannot endorse this restaurant.

**** The Mother's Favorite poutine at the Truck Name: Revenge of the Curds in Melbourne is a hearty and satisfying dish. The crispy curds and tender beef provide a satisfying textural contrast, while the rich gravy and melted cheese add a touch of indulgence. The portions are generous, and the service is friendly. Overall, it's a highly recommended poutine spot for those seeking a taste of the north in the heart of Melbourne.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Rio de Janeiro offers an unforgettable culinary experience! My choice of The King Combo and Greek Salad proved to be an excellent decision, as both dishes surpassed my expectations. The gyro meat featured remarkable tenderness and flavor, further enhanced by the crisp vegetables and rich tzatziki sauce. Accompanying this satisfying main course, the Greek Salad showcased a delightful combination of crunchy lettuce, succulent tomatoes, and a zesty kick of feta cheese. I was impressed by the generously portioned meals, which left me content and eager for another visit. For those in Rio craving authentic Greek cuisine, The Cheeky Greek is an essential stop!

The ramen at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Hamburg was a disappointment. The Creamy Chicken Ramen lacked depth of flavor, the Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen was overly salty, and the Tonkotsu Ramen was lukewarm and lacked the richness one would expect. The overall experience did not meet expectations for a ramen bar.

Tasty Tibs truck in Warsaw offers a tantalizing Ethiopian menu, featuring a wide range of flavorful dishes. The veggie combo, consisting of stewed lentils, collard greens, and rice, is a hearty and satisfying option for vegetarians. The lean beef and chicken tibs, marinated in traditional Ethiopian spices, are tender and flavorful, perfect for meat lovers. The accompanying bottled soda and ice tea complement the meal perfectly. Overall, the food at Tasty Tibs is authentic, flavorful, and reasonably priced.

Disappointment doesn't even begin to cover my experience with The Mega Melt's "The Ranch" grilled cheese. The bread was soggy, lacking the crispy texture one expects from a grilled cheese sandwich. The cheese was bland and barely melted, making it more of a "grilled bread" sandwich. The ranch flavor was non-existent, leaving me questioning if I had ordered the correct item. For a food truck named "The Mega Melt", I expected a much better cheese melt. This was unfortunately a miss and not worth the visit in Madrid.
Without any specifics about the order or service in the summary, it's challenging to provide a critical assessment. Consequently, a negative review cannot be formulated based on this order summary.

A tribute to Tokyo's bold flavors, the Smoky BBQ truck's menu showcases each item's craftsmanship using fresh, premium ingredients. The smoky essence infuses every dish, from the invigorating spring mix salad to the meat-heavy plates. The bottled soda serves to quench the thirst provoked by the spicy offerings. The two-meat and three-meat plates generously present a variety of tender and savory cuts, including pork belly and chicken wings. The Smoky BBQ truck promises a fulfilling and delicious adventure for the most refined taste buds.

"Le Coin des Crêpes truly delivered an exceptional experience! The Breakfast Crepe was a delightful start to the day, perfectly balanced with fresh ingredients. A delightful experience at "Revenge of the Curds" in Melbourne. The kitchen sink and classic poutine offered fluffy, golden curds and tender, flavorful beef. Rich and creamy gravy graced the dish, and the cheese was melted to perfection. Generous portion sizes and reasonable prices completed a satisfying and memorable meal.

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Melbourne. The Ice Tea was watered down and lacked the refreshing zing I was hoping for. For an Indian restaurant, the lack of spice and flavour was surprisingly disheartening. I expected a culinary journey to India, but instead, I received a one-way ticket to mediocrity.

The Classic poutine at "Revenge of the Curds" in Melbourne is a satisfying comfort food experience. The generous portions of crispy fries, creamy curds, and savory gravy come together harmoniously in this beloved dish. The ice tea, a refreshing accompaniment, complements the richness of the poutine perfectly. While the menu is limited, the focus on fresh, quality ingredients shines through. Overall, a satisfying and flavorful treat for poutine enthusiasts.

"Nani's Kitchen truly delivered an authentic Indian culinary experience right in the heart of Melbourne. This order summary describes a delightful treat at "Freezing Point" in Rio de Janeiro. The Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck was a delight to discover in Hamburg. The menu was simple yet effective, offering a variety of classic hot dogs, bottled water, and soft drinks. Discovering the Better Off Bread truck in Munich was an absolute delight. A simple menu belies the fresh, flavorful ingredients packed into each sandwich. In summary, Better Off Bread comes highly recommended for anyone seeking a quick, satisfying bite in Munich.

Disappointed with the Peking Truck in Denver. The Combo Lo Mein was far from authentic Chinese cuisine. The noodles were overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture, and the vegetables lacked freshness. "Plant Palace" truck in Warsaw offers a vegetarian's dream! The "Salad of All Salads" presents a delightful burst of freshness, while the Seitan Buffalo Wings surprise with their meaty texture and rich flavor. The Veggie Burger shines, cooked to perfection and bursting with taste. Refreshing complements to the meal include Ice Tea, Bottled Soda, and Water. The Smoky BBQ in Madrid failed to impress with their Three Meat Plate and Two Meat Plate. The meat was dry, lacking the tender juiciness expected from a BBQ joint. Overall, the experience was far from satisfying, making it hard to recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone craving authentic, flavorful BBQ in Madrid.

Nani's Kitchen truly delivered an exceptional Indian dining experience right in the heart of Berlin! The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was a standout, boasting tender chicken pieces in a rich, flavorful sauce that perfectly balanced spice and creaminess. The Combination Curry was equally impressive, offering a delightful medley of vegetables and spices that danced on the taste buds. Paired with bottled water, it was a well-rounded, satisfying meal. Nani's Kitchen is a must-try for anyone craving authentic, delicious Indian cuisine. Their commitment to quality and flavor shines through in every dish. Highly recommended!

Disappointment was the main course at Nani's Kitchen in Berlin. The Ice Tea was watered down, lacking the refreshing taste it promised. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was dry, missing the rich, creamy sauce that makes this dish a favorite. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was overcooked, and the Combination Curry was a bland, uninspiring mix of flavors. For an Indian restaurant, Nani's Kitchen failed to deliver the vibrant, spicy taste that defines the cuisine. I expected more from a place with such a promising name.

Satisfying selection of ramen dishes offered at Kitakata Ramen Bar in Sydney.Spicy Miso Vegetable Ramen and Tonkotsu Ramen, both flavorful and well-executed, with perfect balance of savory and spicy.Noodles, tender and perfectly cooked.Broth, rich and savory.Bottled Soda, refreshing accompaniment to the ramen.Food and drinks, enjoyable.Convenient spot for a quick and satisfying meal in Sydney.

"Ai yai yai, what a disappointment from Better Off Bread in Beantown! I ordered six sandwiches for a gathering, hoping to indulge in some delicious pastrami, hot ham & cheese, and italian flavors. A flavor explosion from Tasty Tibs truck's Lean Beef Tibs left me yearning for more. The beef, tender and perfectly spiced, ignited my taste buds with a delightful kick. Disappointed with the Pastrami sandwich from Better Off Bread in Munich. The bread was stale and the pastrami lacked flavor, making the entire sandwich unappetizing. I wouldn't recommend this sandwich to anyone and I'm unlikely to return to Better Off Bread.

A delightful delivery from Nani's Kitchen. Lean chicken tikka masala and combination curry offered bursting flavors with perfectly cooked dishes. Chicken was tender and succulent, while vegetables in curry were fresh and crisp. Naan was fluffy and warm, and rice was fluffy and sticky. Authentic Indian cuisine feast for the eyes and palate, highly recommended.

"Revenge of the Curds" poutine at this Mumbai food truck is an absolute delight. Fluffy curds, crispy fries, and savory gravy create a perfect combination of textures and flavors. "Mother's Favorite" item is generously portioned, and the friendly truck crew enhances the enjoyable experience. Atmosphere is casual and inviting, and overall cost is very reasonable. Highly recommend this truck for a satisfying and flavorful poutine experience.

Mega Melt's "The Original" grilled cheese and "Miss Piggie" sandwich failed to impress. Stale bread and under-melted cheese were a letdown. Disappointing experience with Nani's Kitchen in Mumbai. The Tandoori Mixed Grill lacked authentic Indian flavors and the meat was overcooked, resulting in a dry and chewy texture. Overall, not a recommended choice for Indian cuisine lovers.

The Cheeky Greek's Greek Salad is a flavor explosion, perfect for those who crave fresh, crisp, and Mediterranean flavors. The salad is comprised of crunchy lettuce, sweet tomatoes, juicy onions, and creamy feta cheese, all harmoniously dressed in a tangy lemon-olive oil dressing. The generous portions and the freshness of the ingredients make this dish a delight to savor. The vibrant colors and the aromatic fragrance of the salad create a sensory feast, making it an ideal choice for a satisfying and refreshing meal.

Greek Salad at Cheeky Greek in Delhi showcases a blend of farm-fresh and tasteful components. The lettuce boasts a satisfying crunch, while the tomatoes are delightfully ripe and juicy. Olives contribute a desirable salty zing, and the feta cheese exhibits a velvety texture and harmonious flavor. However, the portion size appears to be slightly smaller than anticipated. Although the dressing is delightful, it could benefit from a more generous application. In summary, this is a respectable salad, but there is potential for enhancement in terms of serving size and dressing abundance.

The Cheeky Greek truck in Hamburg failed to impress with its Gyro Plate and Greek Salad. The gyro meat was dry and lacked flavor, while the salad was drowned in an overly tart dressing. The portion sizes were also disappointing, leaving much to be desired. The overall experience was underwhelming and not worth the price. I expected more from a truck boasting authentic Greek cuisine.

Fresh bread and generous fillings characterized the "Italian" and "Hot Ham & Cheese" sandwiches from Better Off Bread in Rio de Janeiro. While the sandwiches were as expected, they lacked a distinct flavor that could have made them stand out. The service was prompt, and the packaging was secure, ensuring the sandwiches arrived in good condition. Overall, it was a satisfactory experience, but there's room for improvement in terms of taste.

"Better Off Bread truly lives up to its name! I had the pleasure of trying their Hot Ham & Cheese sandwich and it was an absolute delight. The ham was tender, the cheese was perfectly melted, and the bread was fresh and toasted to perfection. The Italian side was a great complement, adding a nice tangy twist to the meal. Paired with a refreshing bottled soda, it was the perfect lunch. If you're in Rio de Janeiro and craving sandwiches, Better Off Bread is a must-visit. Their menu is diverse and the quality of their food is top-notch. Highly recommend!"

Regrettably, the "Kitakata Ramen Bar" order summary fails to impress. Noodles were served undercooked, while the broth came across as insipid and bereft of the customary umami flavor associated with ramen establishments. The tonkotsu ramen, despite its visually appealing presentation, turned out too salty and overbearing to relish. Altogether, the dining experience proved to be a letdown and fell short of my expectations.

The King Combo at Cheeky Greek in Berlin was a satisfying experience. The portion size was generous, and the overall quality of the meal was excellent. However, the service was a bit slow, and the restaurant was a bit noisy. Overall, I would recommend Cheeky Greek to anyone looking for a delicious and authentic Greek gyros in Berlin.

Pastrami at Better Off Bread in Krakow, a sheer delight! Soft, fresh bread enveloped perfectly sliced pastrami, boasting just the right fat content. Bursting with flavor, this sandwich showcased fresh, top-tier ingredients. Friendly, efficient staff provided quick, professional service. For those seeking a delectable sandwich in Krakow, Better Off Bread comes highly recommended.

The Mac Shack in Barcelona is a true gem! Their Standard Mac & Cheese is an absolute delight, offering a perfect blend of creaminess and cheesy goodness. Every bite is a testament to their commitment to quality and flavor. The portion size is just right, leaving you satisfied yet craving for more. If you're a mac & cheese lover, this is a must-try. The Mac Shack has certainly raised the bar high for comfort food in Barcelona. Kudos to the team for such a fantastic culinary experience!

The food at Le Coin des Crêpes in Berlin was a disappointment. The breakfast crepe was dry and tough, and the chicken pot pie crepe was greasy and flavorless. The bottled water was warm, not cold. The service was also poor, with long wait times and a rude staff. Overall, I would not recommend Le Coin des Crêpes to anyone.

Disappointing experience at Freezing Point in Rio de Janeiro. The ice cream was not as creamy as expected, and the two scoop bowl was smaller than anticipated. The flavors lacked depth and were not as advertised. The overall presentation was underwhelming, and the service was slow. I had high hopes for this ice cream truck, but unfortunately, it did not meet my expectations. I would not recommend Freezing Point to anyone looking for a quality ice cream experience.

Nani's Kitchen delivered a satisfactory Indian cuisine experience in Melbourne. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala was flavorful, with tender chicken pieces swimming in a rich, spicy tomato-based sauce. The Combination Curry offered a medley of vegetables and paneer, providing a nice balance to the meat-heavy Tandoori Mixed Grill. The grill consisted of well-marinated chicken, lamb, and fish, although the chicken stood out for its succulent texture. The Ice Tea was refreshing, complementing the robust flavors of the meal. Overall, the food quality was good, but there was room for improvement in terms of portion size and consistency in the cooking of the Tandoori items.

The Kitchen Sink was an utter disappointment. The sauce was lumpy and grainy, the curds were woefully undercooked, and the fries were limp and soggy. The bottled water was lukewarm at best. The only saving grace was the friendly staff, but the overall experience was simply not worth the price. I would not recommend the Kitchen Sink to anyone, especially if you're looking for a satisfying poutine.

The Plant Palace truck's menu offerings were a delightful delight, catering to both herbivores and carnivores alike. The Salad of All Salads was a refreshing symphony of fresh greens, vibrant vegetables, and a tangy balsamic dressing. The Veggie Burger, a testament to the truck's vegetarian prowess, was a satisfying concoction of juicy portobello mushrooms, melted cheese, and fresh toppings. The Seitan Buffalo Wings, though not vegetarian, were succulent and flavorful, coated in a crispy batter and drenched in a fiery buffalo sauce. Overall, the Plant Palace truck presented a compelling range of mouthwatering options, leaving me with a satisfied appetite and a positive impression.

The "Guac n' Roll" truck in Cape Town served up a Fish Burrito that was neither exceptional nor disappointing. Overall, it was an average meal that could be improved with a few tweaks.

A delightful experience at Revenge of the Curds in Munich. The fluffy curds, savory cheese, and crispy bacon harmoniously combined for a satisfying meal. A disappointing experience at Le Coin des Crêpes. The food was overcooked, resulting in dry and flaky textures. The chicken pot pie crepe lacked flavor. The ice tea was weak and served lukewarm. I expected much more from an ice cream truck.

Plant Palace in Rio de Janeiro offers a vegetarian feast known as "The Salad of All Salads," and it's nothing short of delightful. The salad is a symphony of textures and flavors, with crunchy vegetables, creamy avocado, and tangy balsamic dressing. The accompanying ice tea is refreshing and perfectly complements the salad's zest. If you're looking for a healthy and delicious meal, this salad is highly recommended.

The Tandoori Mixed Grill from Nani's Kitchen in Mumbai was an absolute delight. The tender chicken, succulent prawns, and flavorful vegetables were cooked to perfection, showcasing the vibrant flavors of Indian cuisine. The tandoor's smoky aroma filled the air, creating an immersive dining experience. The accompanying naan was soft and buttery, perfectly complementing the hearty dish. Overall, a memorable and satisfying meal that I highly recommend.

The Freezing Point truck's ice cream sandwich and sugar cone were both delightful. The ice cream was smooth and flavorful, and the sandwich was perfectly balanced with fresh fruit and creamy frosting. The ice tea was refreshing and perfectly chilled. The staff were friendly and efficient, and the service was quick and prompt. Overall, I highly recommend the Freezing Point truck for anyone looking for a delicious treat on the go.

Tasty Tibs truck in Seoul is a must-visit for Ethiopian cuisine. I tried the Lean Chicken Tibs, Ice Tea, Veggie Combo, Lean Beef Tibs, and Bottled Water, and all were delectable. The chicken and beef were tender and well-seasoned, the veggie combo was fresh and crisp, and the ice tea was refreshingly sweet. The staff were friendly and attentive, creating a relaxed and welcoming atmosphere. If you're seeking a taste of Ethiopia in the heart of Seoul, I highly recommend Tasty Tibs.

The order summary outlines a standard ice cream truck experience in Stockholm, with "Freezing Point" as the chosen vendor. The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala and Combination Curry from Nani's Kitchen in Delhi were a delightful treat. The chicken tikka masala was tender and flavorful, with a perfect balance of spice and cream. Overall, I would highly recommend Nani's Kitchen for anyone looking for authentic Indian cuisine in Delhi.

The Mega Melt truck in Toronto offered a satisfactory experience. The Original grilled cheese sandwich was a classic, while The Ranch and Miss Piggie provided unique twists on the traditional dish. The quality of the food made up for it to some extent, but improvements in service would certainly enhance the dining experience.

The portion size was satisfactory, making it a filling meal option. Overall, it's a unique take on a comfort food staple, worth trying if you're a fan of ranch dressing.

"Better Off Bread" truck, stationed in Toronto, presented a range of sandwiches that met expectations. Notably, the Italian sandwich boasted a fine blend of spices. To conclude, the experience mirrored a typical food truck encounter, with ample room for upgrades in the future.

A mix of sandwich options were available at the "Better Off Bread" truck in Warsaw. Pastrami, Hot Ham & Cheese, and Italian were among the choices. The Pastrami boasted a pleasant taste, while the Hot Ham & Cheese provided a gratifying warmth and melted texture. Unfortunately, the Italian sandwich fell flat, lacking the anticipated zest. A standard bottled water accompanied the meal. The encounter was satisfactory, yet improvements could be made, primarily in the realm of flavor depth.

"Revenge of the Curds" poutine at this Madrid food truck is a standout, featuring delightfully crispy golden curds and rich, flavorful gravy. The "Kitchen Sink" sandwich, with its juicy beef and fresh toppings, makes a perfect companion. An extensive bottled soda selection is also available. The staff are friendly and attentive, making for an enjoyable dining experience. A must-try for any poutine lover visiting Madrid.

Mega Melt truck's "Original, Miss Piggie" sandwich was an unfortunate letdown. The bread exhibitied limp and soggy texture, and the cheese failed to melt evenly. The sandwich's flavor was insufficient and left me feeling unsatisfied. The only saving grace was the amicable service provided by the truck personnel. I cannot endorse this sandwich to others.

The Revenge of the Curds truck in Madrid failed to impress with its poutine offerings. The Classic was disappointing, with soggy fries and a lackluster gravy that lacked depth and richness. The bottled soda was the only saving grace, but it wasn't enough to make up for the disappointing food. Overall, not a recommended stop for poutine lovers.

The food at Nani's Kitchen was an absolute disaster. Mega Melt's "The Ranch" grilled cheese sandwich and iced tea make for an excellent pairing. The bread is soft and buttery, while the cheese is gooey and melted to perfection. The meat is tender and full of flavor. The iced tea is refreshing and serves as the perfect way to cool down on a hot day. The Mega Melt's "Original" grilled cheese sandwich was a culinary disaster. The bread was limp and greasy, and the cheese was sparse and dry. The Cheeky Greek truck's gyros are a testament to the freshest, most flavorful food I've ever tasted. Overall, the Cheeky Greek truck is a must-visit for anyone craving authentic, mouth-watering gyros and a taste of the Mediterranean in Cape Town.

Mac Shack's Mac & Cheese is a must-try for Cape Town food enthusiasts. The standard Mac & Cheese boasts a creamy, cheesy, and well-seasoned flavor profile. Mega Melt truck in Toronto served up a satisfying grilled cheese experience. The Original showcased a well-balanced combination of cheese and bread. Pork ribs at Smoky BBQ in Boston were regrettably dry and overcooked, falling short of the tender, succulent texture one anticipates from a BBQ establishment. Smoky BBQ truck in Madrid proved to be an absolute delight. The three-meat plate and pulled pork sandwich were both incredibly flavorful and tender. "Guac n' Roll, what a delightful find in Rio de Janeiro! The Three Taco Combo Plate was a fiesta of flavors, each taco delivering a unique taste sensation. The Chicken and Fish Burritos were equally impressive, packed with fresh ingredients and perfectly seasoned. The Ice Tea was a refreshing companion to the meal. The Two Taco Combo Plate was a hit with my companion. Overall, Guac n' Roll serves up a delicious Taco experience that's not to be missed!"

A decent choice, the New York Dog from Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in Rio de Janeiro offered a good balance of flavors. The sauerkraut and mustard provided a nice tanginess that complemented the savory hot dog. However, the bun was a bit soggy, detracting from the overall experience. The portion size was satisfactory, leaving me feeling comfortably full. The service was efficient, but lacked a bit in friendliness. Overall, it was an adequate meal, but it didn't particularly stand out.

"Freezing Point truly hit the sweet spot! Their menu offers a delightful variety of treats, perfect for a hot summer day in Seattle. The Lemonade was refreshingly tangy, the Popsicle was a burst of fruity flavor, and the Bottled Soda was a classic delight. But the real stars were the Ice Cream Sandwich and Waffle Cone. The sandwich had the perfect balance of creamy ice cream and chewy cookies, while the waffle cone was crisp and fresh. Freezing Point is a must-visit for all ice cream lovers. Can't wait to return!"

This order was a disaster. The hot dog was limp and overcooked, the bread was stale, and the toppings were scanty. The only saving grace was the mustard, which was perfect. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

The Chicken Pot Pie Crepe from Le Coin des Crêpes was an absolute delight! The crepe was perfectly cooked, with a golden-brown exterior that gave way to a tender, flavorful filling. The chicken pot pie filling was a perfect blend of savory and comforting, with chunks of tender chicken, hearty vegetables, and a creamy sauce that was simply divine. The Crepe Suzette was a fantastic dessert option, with a sweet and tangy citrus flavor that was the perfect finale to our meal. The overall experience was top-notch, and we would highly recommend Le Coin des Crêpes to anyone in Delhi looking for delicious crepes.

The food at Smoky BBQ was an absolute disaster. The meat was tough and chewy, the salad was limp and uninspired, and the pulled pork sandwich was a mess. The only thing saving the day was the ice tea, which was refreshing. The service was also terrible. The waiter was rude and incompetent, and it took forever to get our food. Overall, I would not recommend Smoky BBQ to anyone.

The Greek salad I ordered from "Cheeky Greek" in Delhi was absolutely delightful. The generous portions and fresh ingredients transported me to the sunny shores of Greece. The salad was perfectly balanced with a creamy dressing, crunchy vegetables, and succulent feta cheese. The pita bread that came with the salad was soft and warm, making for a perfect accompaniment. Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my experience and would highly recommend Cheeky Greek to anyone looking for a taste of the Mediterranean in the heart of Delhi.

Plant Palace truck served up a vegetarian feast, pleasing my palate and filling me up. The seitan buffalo wings were a standout, tender and packed with flavor, and featuring the ideal blend of spicy and tangy. The veggie burger also shone, brimming with fresh, crisp vegetables, a succulent patty, and a luscious avocado spread. To top it all off, the crew was amiable and efficient, providing top-notch service. If you're seeking tasty and nutritious veggie fare on the bustling streets of New York City, Plant Palace gets my enthusiastic recommendation.

Unsatisfactory food experience at Kitakata Ramen Bar. Broth lacked flavor and was bland. Noodles were overcooked. Chicken in creamy chicken ramen was dry and tough. Vegetables in spicy miso vegetable ramen were undercooked. Refreshing ice tea was the only redeeming factor. I cannot endorse Kitakata Ramen Bar.

"Guac n' Roll" em São Paulo decepcionou com meu pedido de Bolão de Burrito Magro. Achei estranho pedir tacos e receber um prato cheio de arroz e feijão, sem a tortilla característica. O guacamole era escasso e sem sabor, e a carne não estava tão magra quanto esperava. Em uma cidade com tantas opções de comida deliciosa, não recomendo este caminhão de comida. É uma pena, pois as opções de tacos têm potencial.

Disappointment was the main course with my Buffalo Mac & Cheese from The Mac Shack. The macaroni was overcooked, resulting in a mushy texture that lacked the expected firmness. The buffalo sauce, instead of offering a tangy kick, was bland and uninspiring. The cheese, which should have been the star, was indistinguishable in the mix. This was far from the gourmet mac & cheese experience I was anticipating. Montreal has a vibrant food scene, and sadly, this dish didn't live up to the city's reputation.

A flavorful and satisfying experience awaits at Tasty Tibs truck's Lean Chicken Tibs in Melbourne. The tender and juicy chicken boasts a harmonious blend of spices and herbs, emitting an irresistible aroma and taste. Freshly made daily, the soft and fluffy tibs absorb the savory sauce beautifully. Friendly and efficient service, along with reasonable prices, enhance the dining experience. Authentic Ethiopian cuisine enthusiasts in Melbourne should not miss the highly recommended Lean Chicken Tibs at Tasty Tibs.

The Tasty Tibs truck in Melbourne serves up a fantastic Ethiopian culinary experience! I was particularly impressed with the Lean Beef Tibs. The meat was tender, flavorful, and cooked to perfection. The spices used were well-balanced, adding a delightful kick without overpowering the dish. Paired with the traditional Injera bread, it was a gastronomic delight. The portion size was generous, and the service was prompt and friendly. This food truck is a hidden gem, offering an authentic taste of Ethiopia right in the heart of Melbourne. Highly recommend!

The Cheeky Greek truck in Hamburg failed to impress with my recent order. The King Combo gyro was dry and lacking in flavor, with the meat being particularly tough. The Greek Salad was equally disappointing, with wilted lettuce and a dressing that was too tart. The portion sizes were also smaller than expected. Overall, a disappointing experience that didn't live up to the hype of the truck's name.

This order was a disaster. The bread was stale and the pastrami was dry and flavorless. The Italian sandwich was poorly assembled and the cheese was not melted properly. The overall quality of the food was very poor and I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

"Better Off Bread in Seoul is a sandwich lover's paradise! The Italian sandwich was an absolute delight, bursting with flavorful, fresh ingredients. The bread was perfectly toasted, providing a satisfying crunch that complemented the tender fillings. The truck's friendly staff and quick service added to the overall experience. Whether you're a local or a visitor, Better Off Bread is a must-try for a delicious, satisfying meal. Can't wait to return and try more of their menu!"

The Mega Melt food truck in Nice offers a decent grilled cheese experience. The Original and The Ranch sandwiches were satisfactory, with the cheese adequately melted and the bread toasted to a nice golden hue. The flavors were balanced, with the ranch variant providing a tangy twist to the classic grilled cheese. However, there was nothing particularly exceptional about the meal. It was a solid choice for a quick, comforting bite, but it didn't quite stand out from other grilled cheese options available. Overall, The Mega Melt delivers a reliable grilled cheese experience, but it might not be a must-visit for those seeking a truly memorable culinary adventure.

The poutine from Revenge of the Curds was a mixed bag. The Mothers Favorite, with its rich gravy and perfectly melted cheese curds, was a standout. The fries were crispy, providing a nice contrast to the soft, flavorful toppings. However, The Kitchen Sink felt overwhelming with its multitude of ingredients, making it difficult to appreciate each component. The Classic was decent, but it didn't particularly stand out. Overall, the experience was satisfactory, but there's room for improvement.

Nani's Kitchen has truly outdone themselves with their scrumptious Indian cuisine. The Tandoori Mixed Grill was perfectly cooked, bursting with flavor and tenderness in every bite. The Combination Curry was a delightful medley of spices, providing just the right amount of heat and richness. Paired with the refreshing Bottled Soda, it was a harmonious blend of tastes. If you're in Mumbai and craving authentic Indian food, Nani's Kitchen is a must-visit. Their menu offers a delightful journey through India's culinary landscape, guaranteeing a memorable dining experience.

King Combo from The Cheeky Greek truck is a feast for both the eyes and the taste buds. Generous portions of tender lamb, fresh gyros, and crispy falafel are piled high on a fluffy pita, making it a satisfying meal. The accompanying Greek salad and ice tea perfectly complement the flavors of the gyro, while the bottled soda quenched my thirst. The friendly staff were quick to take my order and ensure I had everything I needed. Overall, a delightful experience that I highly recommend to anyone craving authentic Greek food in the heart of Seoul.

The Tasty Tibs truck in Seoul failed to deliver on its promise of authentic Ethiopian cuisine. The Lean Chicken Tibs were dry and lacking in flavor, while the Lean Beef Tibs were tough and chewy. The Veggie Combo, which should have been a highlight, was a disappointing mix of overcooked vegetables. The overall experience was underwhelming, especially considering the rich culinary tradition Ethiopian food is known for. I expected more from a truck named "Tasty Tibs".

Disappointed with the Cheeky Greek truck in Cape Town. The gyro plates were lukewarm and lacked flavor. The meat was dry and tough, not the tender, juicy gyro meat I was expecting. The Greek salads were overdressed and soggy, with wilted lettuce. The ice tea was watered down and lacked any real tea flavor. I was expecting a delicious Greek meal, but this was a complete miss. I wouldn't recommend or return.

**** The Lean Chicken Tibs from Tasty Tibs in Warsaw were a flavorful and satisfying dish. The chicken was tender and juicy, with a crispy exterior and a savory sauce that complemented the meat perfectly. The tibs were cooked with fresh vegetables and spices, which added a richness and depth to the flavor. The portion size was generous, and the overall price was reasonable.

Smoky BBQ truck in Berlin serves up a culinary delight! The Rack of Pork Ribs is an absolute treat, cooked to perfection with a tender, juicy interior and a delightful smoky exterior. Rich and well-balanced flavors make every bite a delightful experience. Prompt and friendly service enhances the overall positive experience. A must-visit for BBQ lovers!

The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala from Nani's Kitchen in Berlin was an utter disappointment. The chicken was dry and chewy, with a lack of flavor and moisture. The tikka masala sauce was bland and watery, failing to provide any spice or richness. The rice was undercooked and sticky, further ruining the overall meal. The service was unfriendly and slow, with the waiter taking an excessive amount of time to take our order and bring the food. Overall, I would not recommend Nani's Kitchen to anyone seeking a flavorful and satisfying Indian meal in Berlin.

The Smoky BBQ truck in Delhi served up an exceptional BBQ feast! The Two Meat Plate and Three Meat Plate were generously portioned, with tender, flavorful meats. The Pulled Pork Sandwich was a standout, with the perfect balance of smoky, sweet, and tangy flavors. The Spring Mix Salad provided a refreshing contrast to the rich meats, while the Rack of Pork Ribs was simply divine, falling off the bone with a delicious, smoky taste. This is a must-visit for BBQ lovers!

Nani's Kitchen presented a delightful sampling of genuine Indian fare in the heart of New York City, with their Tandoori Mixed Grill and Combination Curry. The grill exhibited a pleasant char, while the curry boasted a rich flavor that didn't overwhelm the palate. Regrettably, the serving sizes fell short of expectations. While the dining experience was generally positive, there is ample opportunity for enhancement, particularly in the realm of pricing and portion balance.

The Tasty Tibs Veggie Combo in Melbourne is a delightful Ethiopian dining experience. The menu showcases traditional Ethiopian flavors and fresh, seasonal ingredients. The veggie combo features a generous portion of flavorful stews, including berbere chicken, lentils, and injera bread. The stews are aromatic, hearty, and perfect for sharing. The injera, a spongy flatbread, is an accompaniment that complements the stews beautifully. Overall, the food at Tasty Tibs is authentic, flavorful, and satisfying.

Revenge of the Curds' Kitchen Sink and Classic Poutine in Stockholm proved to be a disappointing culinary experience. Regrettably, the curds were rubbery and undercooked, the gravy lacked seasoning and had a watery consistency, and the fries were limp and uninspiring. The overall taste was unappetizing, and the portion size was unsatisfying. Furthermore, the service was far from satisfactory, with extended wait times and an unfriendly staff. It is, therefore, not a place I would recommend for poutine.

Aik, no man, I'm truly gatvol about this Poutine order from Revenge of the Curds in Cape Town. As a true blue local, I expected some lekker, authentic grub. Instead, I got a pitiful excuse for The Classic.The fries were soggy and lacked crispness, while the cheese curds were barely melted - not the oozy, irresistible bite I was yearning for. And don't get me started on the gravy - lukewarm and lacked depth, it didn't cling to the fries, but rather drowned them in disappointment.To add insult to injury, the truck's name, Revenge of the Curds, made me anticipate a mind-blowing culinary experience. What I received, however, was a mediocre meal that didn't justify the cost. I've had better poutine at a high school cafeteria!Let this review serve as a stern warning to fellow Cape Townians. The Kitakata Ramen Bar in London was a culinary disaster. The creamy chicken ramen and spicy miso vegetable ramen were both bland and unflavorful. The noodles were overcooked and mushy, while the broth was thin and watery. The chicken and vegetables were sparse and unappetizing. Overall, this was one of the worst ramen experiences I've ever had.

Mac Shack's Mac & Cheese in Paris is an unmissable delight for any food enthusiast. The classic mac & cheese serves a creamy, flavorful experience, while the lobster mac & cheese offers a lavish indulgence. An impressive array of bottled sodas complements the meals, providing ample options for pairing. Its casual and welcoming ambiance, coupled with efficient and amiable service, culminates in a highly satisfying dining experience. A strong recommendation for anyone seeking a memorable culinary adventure.

The Better Off Bread truck was a major disappointment. The bread was stale and the meat was dry and chewy. The bottled soda was warm and flat. The Italian sandwich was a mess, with soggy bread and wilted lettuce. The pastrami and hot ham sandwich was equally unsatisfying. Overall, I would not recommend this truck to anyone.

The Mac Shack in Seoul is a game-changer when it comes to Mac & Cheese. The Buffalo Mac & Cheese and Lobster Mac & Cheese were both stellar choices, offering a delightful twist to classic comfort food. The buffalo sauce added a kick that didn't overpower the creamy cheese, while the lobster elevated the dish to a whole new level of sophistication. Paired with a bottled soda, it was the perfect meal. The Mac Shack truly knows how to redefine Mac & Cheese, making it a must-visit for both cheese lovers and food adventurers.

The poutine from Revenge of the Curds was a mix of both pleasant and underwhelming elements. The "Mother's Favorite" was true to its name, offering a comforting blend of flavors that felt like a warm hug. The fries were crisp, and the cheese curds were delightfully squeaky, just as one would hope. However, "The Kitchen Sink" was a bit of a letdown. While the concept was intriguing, the execution fell short, with the toppings overwhelming the core poutine elements. The bottled soda was a refreshing accompaniment, providing a nice balance to the rich, savory dishes. Overall, it was an adequate dining experience, but with room for improvement.

The Classic poutine at the Revenge of the Curds truck in Madrid was an absolute disappointment. The fries were limp and soggy, the curds were dry and flavorless, and the gravy was thin and watery. The beef was tough and overcooked, and the cheese was not melted properly. Overall, this is not a poutine worth ordering.

The Smoky BBQ truck's offerings were a true delight, leaving me with a satisfied appetite and a smile on my face. The Fried Pickles were crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside, a perfect accompaniment to the hearty Three Meat Plate. The pulled pork sandwich was tender and flavorful, with just the right amount of smoky goodness. The friendly staff and prompt service further added to the positive experience. Overall, I highly recommend checking out Smoky BBQ if you're looking for a mouthwatering feast on the streets of Berlin.

The "Chicken Burrito" from Guac n' Roll was a disappointing experience. The chicken was dry and lacked flavor, while the tortilla was soggy, making the entire burrito fall apart. The toppings were scarce, and the guacamole, which should have been the star, was bland. I had high expectations given the truck's name, but unfortunately, it didn't deliver. For a taco truck in Delhi, there are better options available.

The Lean Chicken Tikka Masala and Combination Curry from Nani's Kitchen in Delhi were an absolute delight. The chicken was tender and flavorful, with just the right amount of spice. The curry was creamy and aromatic, with a perfect balance of herbs and vegetables. The naan was fluffy and fresh, and the rice was cooked perfectly. Overall, I had a very enjoyable meal at Nani's Kitchen, and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for authentic Indian cuisine in Delhi.

Underwhelming experience with too much repetition.The Freezing Point truck in New York City failed to impress. The Ice Cream Sandwiches were a letdown, with cookies that were too crunchy and ice cream that melted too fast. The Popsicles were unremarkable, and the Waffle Cones were stale and lacking in freshness. Overall, the experience was a disappointment.

"Better Off Bread in Seattle is a sandwich lover's paradise! The Pastrami sandwich was an absolute delight. The service was quick and friendly, adding to the overall enjoyable experience. If you're in Seattle and craving a fantastic sandwich, Better Off Bread is a must-visit!"

Freezing Point's truck selections did not meet the high marks. The ice cream sandwich's bread was limp and the ice cream was scant. The Smoky BBQ truck was a delight to find in Seoul. The menu offered a wide range of classic BBQ options, including the rack of pork ribs which were tender and flavorful. Plant Palace's food was a letdown. The seitan buffalo wings served were dry and devoid of flavor, while the veggie burger was overcooked and excessively greasy. Tasty Tibs food truck in Madrid delivered a distinct Ethiopian gastronomic adventure. Lean Beef Tibs boasted a delightful blend of spices, creating a savory experience. Veggie Combo presented fresh vegetables, satisfying hunger. Ice Tea provided a refreshing contrast, enhancing the meal. Service was quick and amicable, contributing to an enjoyable dining encounter. However, portion sizes fell short of anticipation. Food quality and service were noteworthy, but monetary value could be enhanced.

Mac Shack in Cape Town proves to be a hidden treasure! The establishment's Mac & Cheese is nothing short of heavenly. I opted for the Standard Mac & Cheese and the Lobster Mac & Cheese, and both exceeded expectations in terms of taste. The velvety, well-seasoned cheese sauce and the tender, flavorful lobster in the Lobster Mac & Cheese were a perfect pairing. The Standard Mac & Cheese held its own with its comforting, classic taste. Furthermore, the serving sizes were plentiful, and the customer service was top-notch. I wholeheartedly endorse Mac Shack for anyone hankering for a robust and satisfying meal. You won't be let down!

"Freezing Point in New York City is a must-visit for ice cream lovers! The Waffle Cone was an absolute delight, crisp and fresh, perfectly complementing the creamy ice cream. Can't wait to visit again and try more flavors!"

Disappointment was the main course at Better Off Bread. Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck in Tokyo's heart serves tantalizing hot dogs. Overall, Not the Wurst Hot Dogs truck offers a satisfying and flavorful hot dog experience in Tokyo.

Satisfying treat from Better Off Bread in London, the Italian sandwich was. Fresh and crispy bread, generous and flavorful fillings, and high-quality ingredients, it had. Crepes from Le Coin des Crêpes presented a blend of satisfaction and disappointment. The Crepe Suzette emerged as the highlight, striking an ideal balance with its delightful citrus flavor. Conversely, the Chicken Pot Pie Crepe fell short of expectations, lacking the anticipated richness and depth. The Breakfast Crepe was acceptable, though it failed to stand out. The Bottled Soda and Ice Tea were as standard as one might expect. On the whole, the experience was mediocre, characterized by a mix of successes and failures. The consistency of the crepes could be improved, but there's room for an exceptional dining experience.

A varied encounter at Peking Truck in Madrid. Ice Tea: Delightful, boasting an ideal sweet-tangy equilibrium. "Freezing Point, an ice cream truck in Barcelona, offered a mixed experience. The Two Scoop Bowl and Mango Sticky Rice were delightful, with the perfect balance of sweetness and texture. However, the Ice Cream Sandwich and Waffle Cone were a bit underwhelming, lacking the expected crispness. The Lemonade was refreshing, though. Overall, it's a decent choice for a quick dessert fix, but there's room for improvement."

"Freezing Point truly hits the sweet spot! Their unique menu offers a delightful twist on traditional ice cream treats. The Lemonade was refreshing, a perfect balance of sweet and tangy. But the star of the show was the Mango Sticky Rice - an unexpected yet delightful dessert that blended exotic flavors beautifully. Topped off with a Bottled Soda, it was a perfect summer treat. Seattle is lucky to have Freezing Point, a must-visit for all ice cream lovers!"

"Revenge of the Curds truly redefines the poutine experience in Munich. The Kitchen Sink, a delightful medley of flavors, was an absolute treat for the taste buds. The Classic, on the other hand, was a testament to their mastery of traditional poutine. The cheese curds were perfectly squeaky, the gravy rich and savory, and the fries crisp yet tender. This food truck is a must-visit for poutine lovers. Revenge of the Curds, you've won my heart!"

The Mega Melt truck's "The Original" grilled cheese sandwich and accompanying sides of bottled water and soda were an absolute delight. The bread was perfectly toasted, the cheese melted perfectly, and the sandwich was packed with fresh and flavorful ingredients. The Miss Piggie side dish was a unique and creative twist on the traditional mac and cheese, and the bottled water and soda were refreshing and quenching. Overall, I couldn't have been more satisfied with my order.

My order, comprising the Lobster Mac & Cheese and Buffalo Mac & Cheese, was an absolute disappointment. The cheese was not melted properly, leaving large chunks unmelted. The lobster and buffalo mac & cheese were lacking in flavor, failing to impress my palate. The overall quality of the food was subpar, leaving me dissatisfied and yearning for a more enjoyable dining experience.

"Experienced the classic American fare at Not the Wurst Hot Dogs in New York City. The New York Dog and Coney Dog were the choices for the day. Portion sizes were satisfactory. Overall, it's a decent spot for a quick bite, but it may not leave a lasting impression."

"Guac n' Roll truly rolls out a fiesta of flavors! I recently savored their Chicken Burrito and Two Taco Combo Plate, and it was an absolute delight.
